solution_line_template: Theodore's total earnings from the stone statues are {num_stone_statues} x ${cost_stone_statue} = ${<<{num_stone_statues}*{cost_stone_statue}={earnings_stone_statues}>>}{earnings_stone_statues}.
His total earnings from wooden statues are {num_wooden_statues} x ${cost_wooden_statue} = ${<<{num_wooden_statues}*{cost_wooden_statue}={earnings_wooden_statues}>>}{earnings_wooden_statues}.

So his total earnings from the stone and wooden statue are ${earnings_stone_statues} + ${earnings_wooden_statues} = ${<<{earnings_stone_statues}+{earnings_wooden_statues}={total_earnings_before_tax}>>}{total_earnings_before_tax}.

The amount he pays for the tax is ${total_earnings_before_tax} x {tax_percentage_numerator}/{tax_percentage_denominator} = ${<<{total_earnings_before_tax}*{tax_percentage_numerator}/{tax_percentage_denominator}={tax_amount}>>}{tax_amount}.
Therefore his total monthly earnings are ${total_earnings_before_tax} - ${tax_amount} = ${<<{total_earnings_before_tax}-{tax_amount}={total_monthly_earnings}>>}{total_monthly_earnings}.
